website_summaries.verdict: Adding Mobil’s premium automatic transmission fluid to your car will protect it from blistering heat, freezing cold, and clogging buildup for a smoother overall ride.
pros: Keeps transmissions clean and running smoothly
cons: Best for high-performance cars and light trucks

customer_reviews.title: Great ATF fluid.
customer_reviews.text: My car uses ATF for power steering, the synthetic is nicer stuff. This will fit most, but not all transmissions. Pulled from the product data sheet available online: Mobil 1 Synthetic ATF meets or exceeds the requirements of: JASO 1-A Ford Mercon V According to ExxonMobil, Mobil 1 Synthetic ATF is of the following quality level: Allison C-4 General Motors Dexron IIIH General Motors Dexron IIIG General Motors Dexron IIE General Motors Dexron IID General Motors Dexron II General Motors Dexron Ford Mercon MAN 339 V1 Volvo 97340 Volvo 97341
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION FLUID
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE ONLY SYNTHETIC TRANS FLUID TO USE. THIS IS ALL WE USE IN OUR RACE CAR TRANS, AND IN MY F-450 TOW TRUCK. AFTER 10YEARS WE HAVE NOT HAD A TRANS FAILURE IN BOTH OF MY RACE CARS. EVERY YEAR WE GO THRU AND CHECK THE TRANS AND THE GEARS ARE IN GREAT SHAPE. NEW SEALS AND GASKETS, NEW FLUID AND BACK IN BOTH CARS FOR THE NEW RACE SEASON.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Arwood

customer_reviews.title: Sierra Hotel
customer_reviews.text: I just R&R’d the ATF fluid in my 2013 Tacoma with Mobil 1 ATF. The OEM Toyota WS ATF oil (like all other car mfg) is the sole Toyota factory recommended product however, previous experience using Mobil 1 in other vehicles with stellar results says otherwise. Mobil One doesn’t disappoint and will outlast and outperform non synthetics, it’s scientifically tested and proven so. Great product, highly recommended. RR
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Not rated for MOPAR Chrysler ATF
customer_reviews.text: I could have sworn years ago this stuff was rated for Chrysler (MOPAR) transmissions. I've been running it in my older car (ATF+3 generation) for several thousand miles without issues. Did a transmission swap on a newer Jeep requiring ATF+4, bought a whole bunch of this stuff and then had to return it after I realized MOPAR specs are excluded from the label. Either they didn't want to pay for lab testing or copyright to put it on the bottle and its OK to use or maybe its not. Regardless, MOPAR fluid was half the price so why not just put in the OEM spec and have some reassurance all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Mobil 1 Tranny fluid
customer_reviews.text: Ever had a hard shifting 92 Honda Accord transaxle that no one seems to be able to address? Want to know why? It is the cheapo aftermarket transmission fluid some knuckle head ripoff shop tossed in there during one of the previous lube changes. Usually at one of the overcharging quick lube type places. Flush that garbage out of there and use this! And pretty much forget about transmission problems. It lasts forever, and suddenly the transaxle shifts smoother like it is supposed to. Runs quieter and cooler. I had been using Mobil 1 synthetics in all our racing engines for decades. Now add this to the list.
customer_reviews.author: Randyman

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong With Mobil 1.
customer_reviews.text: Installed Mobil 1 synthetic transmission fluid and a new filter in my 2000 Ford F-250 with a 4R100 automatic transmission. Yes this fluid costs more than conventional transmission fluid but I'm also going to employ a 50,000 mile change interval versus the manufacturer recommended 35,000. Gives me peace of mind to do preventative maintenance on my old Ford.
customer_reviews.author: California Customer 67

customer_reviews.title: I always use synthetic and the engines always get better, now I put synthetics through out the cars ...
customer_reviews.text: I always buy used cars and end up nursing the engine to keep them going. I always use synthetic and the engines always get better, now I put synthetics through out the cars drivetrain, transmissions, differentials. I have a 1990 ford, they are known to have whinny sounding power steering pumps, I put synthetic transmission fluid in it and gradually over a period of months the whining went away.
customer_reviews.author: James Vanpelt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Did a complete Transmission fluid change on my 2002 ford escape! I had no problems with the vehicle and felt like it shifted gears fine before the fluid change.After the fluid change the transmission shifts were almost imperceptible. The difference was immediate and apparent. Going to do this with all my vehicles. I'm a believer!
customer_reviews.author: Monkeysee

customer_reviews.title: It works great. I can feel a difference in performance right ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I can feel a difference in performance right away. I also purchased another case for my son's car, which had a check engine light on. Code reader said there was a transmission issue. After he poured this fluid in and drove for a couple of days, the check engine light went off. ***Update 10/26/2016*** After over a month of running my 2004 Tacoma 3.4L 4X4 with this transmission fluid, I notice my transmission continues to run smoother than before. I really like the smooth shifting of gears. The sluggish response before is not there anymore. I plan to replace this within 30K miles.
customer_reviews.author: Yobcibmuag

customer_reviews.title: Made my old girl feel young again!!
customer_reviews.text: This fluid brought my 3rd gen 4Runner transmission back to life. 4Runner has OEM Toyota Dex III Dino fluid in her. This fluid made her shift flawlessly. Very happy with this synthetic!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Very reasonably priced. Used this to flush out my power steering fluid for my vehicles due to the fact they require ATF. It is Mobil 1, you can't go wrong as long as you use it for its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Emac

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Been using Mobil 1 for years with great results. My 2nd car that I won't get rid of is now almost 20 years old with no mechanical issues. Just keep up the maintenance with quality materials like mobile 1.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Not your average transmission fluid!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff! Improved performance noticeably when I flushed the transmission of my Ford truck.
customer_reviews.author: Karmike

customer_reviews.title: Shifting perceptively smoother
customer_reviews.text: Taking youtube mechanic Scotty Kilmer's advice to change the fluid, shifting on my 16 year old Toyota is perceptively smoother. MPG improved slightly too.
customer_reviews.author: MacadamiaMac

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good Mobil 1 ATF. Make sure your car uses this and try not to mix brands if possible. I would recommend changing atf after sitting overnight. My car will drain back most of the fluid to the pan when it's cold so you can change more of it. Don't get a power flush!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Superior oil that I have used for my power steering system in my Tacoma. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Mobil 1=good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is exacty what I needed to change the ATF in my F250. Recommend this if you haul heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Jleedog

customer_reviews.title: Will save your transmission
customer_reviews.text: The best ever ATF. Saved a clunky transmission. Best $10 I ever spent. Mobil 1 products are top of the line. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Robin

customer_reviews.title: v-twin additive
customer_reviews.text: I use this as part of a blend in the primary chain case of my big twin Harley. Recommended to keep the clutch plates cool and primary chain lubed.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer Sooner

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t find this at the local parts stores and I’m not sure if it was a great deal but it worked well
customer_reviews.author: Dave E

customer_reviews.title: 000 MILES ON IT TRANS STILL SHIFTS PERFECT.
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE USED THIS TRANS FLUID FOR 22 YEARS.I HAVE A BUICK REGAL 1990 WITH 236,000 MILES ON IT TRANS STILL SHIFTS PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: silver streak

customer_reviews.title: Good price! Better than Autozone.
customer_reviews.text: Came in a medium size box. More than enough ATF to allow me to drain and replace the transmission filter. I still have two bottles left over. Great stuff for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Always a quality product..
customer_reviews.text: The fluid is known for its quality and is required and recommended by the auto manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: MOBIL ATF
customer_reviews.text: Best ATF ... BENZ certified 236.14 USE on BENZ SL63 2011 AMG with P30 Performance Package...
customer_reviews.author: augustusmojo

customer_reviews.title: Good lube
customer_reviews.text: It made the tranny happy, she slid in n out of gear like a pro
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product as with all Mobil 1 products. We use this on our older race car and we haven't had any issues over the last eight years.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2000 Xterra would not engage in drive but it would ...
customer_reviews.text: 2000 Xterra would not engage in drive but it would engage in lows 1 and 2. Drained the old fluid and put in this synthetic fluid and it made a world of difference immediately. It engages now in drive and shifts much smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wright

customer_reviews.title: Best transmission oil around
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this type of oil on all my cars for the last 15 years and has never failed me. The climate where I live now is year round tropical and the oil easily withstands the temperatures here. Best to buy at Amazon not at a local auto parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2004 Nissan XTerra
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my 2004 Nissan XTerra. Worth the extra $$$, by far the best ATF fluid on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry, Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Well built excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: Shifts easier then ever truck has 209000 never did internal filter nor synthetic oil. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Delores Houck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the transmission fluid in 2000 model S-Series Saturn with Mobil One ATF. I had to replace a solenoid in the transmission to address a hard shift issue and followed the recommendations of the Saturn forum and YouTube videos on the installation. Mobil One ATF was highly recommended by others as the best replacement fluid and I now share the same feelings. I own many cars and this Saturn is my family's hop in and go vehicle used for economic fuel mileage. This is an inexpensive small car and after the Mobil One ATF change - the transmission is now shifting as smoothly as a more expensive automobile.
customer_reviews.author: 429SCJ

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my car
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good full synthetic ATF for my Nissan Xterra (2002). When I was done changing the fluid, the shifting was immediately smoother. I would recommend this product for any vehicles that it says it will work for, but I'm not an expert on car repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Holden

customer_reviews.title: Always a great experience with Mobil products.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Mobil products for the last 20 years. I've never been let down, and this particular synthetic ATF works out very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: J.T.Ward

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works well in my chevelle. Only the best for her
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Front pump was leaking at seal in the T/C with ...
customer_reviews.text: Front pump was leaking at seal in the T/C with new Dex/Mer fluid didn't leak with old Mercon fluid put Mobil 1 in problem solved i would have never believed it
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Mobil 1 full synthetic for everything
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't go with anything else that's a fact. 2011 CHEVY SILVERADO 1500 LTZ only run the best. The fee extra $$$ well worth it
customer_reviews.author: janell Barts

customer_reviews.title: Mobil 1 yes!
customer_reviews.text: Best price for a pack of 6 synthetic trans. fluid. First time changing trans fluid on 2001 Silverado (70000 miles), Mobile 1 is an excellent product which you cant go wrong with. Just make sure you read owners manual for vehicle and ensure you use the correct trans fluid recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Super slick
customer_reviews.text: It’s slick and it lubricates and it carries away heat.
customer_reviews.author: Speedfast

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I got the urge to get down and dirty so that I could change out the tranny fluid in my Ford V10 transmission. It took two of these cases so that I could drain and refill the torque converter as well. When I grew up, a case was 24 quarts, cases now days are down to 6 quarts I guess. Good quality fluid, should keep the tranny going for some time.
customer_reviews.author: buckhunter

customer_reviews.title: Can tell a difference in the way my truck's transmission ...
customer_reviews.text: Can tell a difference in the way my truck's transmission shifts, it shifts a lot smoother and runs a few degrees cooler then the Motorcraft trans fluid. I'll be buying Mobil 1 for my next oil change.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Watson

customer_reviews.title: Better then mercon v
customer_reviews.text: Best trans fluid for my explorer.. If you look at the website it's rated for Fords designed for mercon v... Truck shifts smoother.. Keeps the heat down.. or had longevity for sure..
customer_reviews.author: chris Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my Volvo and always have, no issues ever.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really like the Mobil1 ATF fluid. It's seems to allow faster smoother shifts in all my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: If you need some good ATF, buy THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 2009 Crown Victoria Police Interceptor with 89,xxx. Ford recommends you change the fluid every 30k in the 4R75W's under sever duty conditions. After much research i decided to go with Mobil 1 mostly due to my past positive experiences with their motor oil, plus you cant beat this price. All in all it was a great call, put 4 quarts in and a bottle of Lucas Transmission Fix for an extra helping hand, night and day difference. For the price and the quality of the fluid, this is a must buy, do not pass this deal up.
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: No more transmission noise
customer_reviews.text: At least so far. When it got cold out transmission would make noise. So far, so good after transmission fluid change and filter. Also, every once in a while, it would clunk a bit when shifting from forward to reverse. Haven't experience that as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: 2006 F150
customer_reviews.text: Shifting is much smoother on my 2006 F150. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same great product as stores but lower price
customer_reviews.text: Same great product as stores but lower price. Waiting on my Mobil rebate as I hope it works for Amazon purchases, will update if Mobil doesn't honor it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: marked improvement
customer_reviews.text: did one drain (~4 quarts) and refill on a 98 impreza and this fluid had a marked improvement on shifting, much smoother shifts over all. still a noticeable one once and a while in heavy traffic but 85% hardly felt
customer_reviews.author: Ian MacIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Top in it's Class
customer_reviews.text: I use this product in the manual transmissions and transfer cases of my Ford Superduties, and also in my snow plow. The product is high quality and I ordered it from Amazon.com this time around because they had the best price that I could get anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Timbers

customer_reviews.title: best fork oil ever
customer_reviews.text: I have a several motorcycles. This stuff is the best fork oil on the planet. That's all I use it for and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Parker

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good synthetic fluid but only is approved up to dexron 3 i switched to red line d6
customer_reviews.author: michael johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is the best synthetic ATF to replace a non synthetic (Dexron) in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best synthetic ATF to replace a non synthetic (Dexron) in your car or truck. I used this in my 2002 Toyota Tundra which calls for Dexron. Toyota makes a synthetic (Type IV) for 2003 and later and doesn't recommend using Type IV in a 2002. This makes the Mobil 1 synthetic ATF a perfect fit. It's well worth the price! BTW: If you are switching from a non synthetic, especially if your old ATF is brown, I would strongly urge you to do a 12-16 quart flush using the cooler lines. This will ensure you have a clean install.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: We used this to replace transmission oil in a 1995 E300 Mercedes and it seems to work well. The unit shirts well and the oil appears to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Webster

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST SYNTHETIC AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION FLUID
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST SYNTHETIC AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION FLUID , I USE IT ON MY 97 7.3 POWERSTROKE , WORKS GREAT , MY TRUCK ITS SMOOTHER!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: All high end cars recommend Mobil-1 how can you go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: It’s Mobil 1 synthetic ATF not much more to say
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Better than the stuff the dealership puts in.
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my Hyundai Sonata. According to the owners manual, this fluid isn't rated for it. I did some research online and found that the Hyundai certification is close to one that it is certified for. I only swapped out half of it and all my transmission issues went away. When I tow it no longer smells like the transmission is going to blow up. I haven't had it in winter yet to see how well it handles the cold but it can't be worse than the stuff the dealership put in.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Top quality at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Mobil1 Synthetic is a top quality product that lives up to the hype. Shifting is greatly improved and mpg are up slightly as well. I've never been disappointed with Mobil 1 Synthetic and that is why I don't mind paying a bit more for top quality and consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Green Mountain Audi

customer_reviews.title: 2007 mazda 6..
customer_reviews.text: Do you want your automatic transmission on your ford to last? just do a drain and fill every 30000 miles or so and forget..Its that good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal with rebate
customer_reviews.text: Received my case (6 quartz) and mailed my $12.00 rebate, which is a great deal. I've been running the Mobil 1 ATF for about a hundred miles, haven't noticed any difference but that's not a bad thing. With my Montero pushing the 150k mark anything that will keep it in better working order is worth a try; you can't go wrong with mobile 1. Just expect it to fix a mechanical problem, the product isn't a mechanic but will keep your tranny lubed better than conventional ATF.
customer_reviews.author: Scottsdale74

customer_reviews.title: Great price!
customer_reviews.text: This highly compatible fluid works in ever car I have. With regular changes, your transmission should last a long time. I use Mobile One because of its resistance to heat and low temperature flow characteristics. Really, my car does not seem any different than with the OEM fluid. But the cost difference is minimal and I am confident that Mobile One will provide long lasting protection.
customer_reviews.author: Dollar Conscious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ATF Oil
customer_reviews.text: My 2007 Toyota Yaris was having 110k miles on it. So it was time for ATF change. I did extensive research and zeroed on this product. Excellent ATF. My mechanic also said that it is excellent ATF oil.
customer_reviews.author: amit

customer_reviews.title: All-Climate Transmission Protection
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit pricey, but well worth the cost -- I spent the extra bucks to do a complete (drained transmission AND torque converter) fluid change when changing the transmission filter and installing a B&M Shift Improver Kit. I stuck with the Mobil 1 synthetic, and I'm glad I did. The transmission shifts beautifully -- crisp, firm up-shifts and down-shifts -- with no lag or hesitation. Here in the desert climate, the extra protection against heat build-up will help my transmission run cooler and last longer -- and when I go to the cold country, the synthetic fluid will flow properly at extremely cold temps, too. Amazon's price was lower than the local parts/speed shops -- it's a no-brainer!!
customer_reviews.author: Rust Never Sleeps

customer_reviews.title: 2003 Ford Escape 3.0L
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my 2003 Ford Escape. As you can't change the filter on the transmission, so I do the partial empty and fill once a year. I have used the Mobile 1 ATF for the last 4 years (~30,000 miles) and the transmission is running smoother than when we bought the car.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Parker

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than you can get at the stores.
customer_reviews.text: Quality product. I do the the drain (2.5qts) and refill of ATF fluid and it seems to make the Avalon shifting very smooth now at 110K miles.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind........
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the few extra buck for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only transmission fluid to use, I have worked on cars for years and I personally recommend this to anyone that's servicing a transmission. It will withstand the beating of towing or hard driving with no damage to your transmission. You cannot go wrong with mobile 1. The seller shipped it fast and it arived within a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Stormborn1776

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted and order. I have used this before.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly L.

customer_reviews.title: good product in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: works very well for me, trans feels smooth and performs as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bretland

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the tranny man away.
customer_reviews.text: ATF, check. True synthetic base stock, check. Make my transmission happy, check.
customer_reviews.author: Andréa B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love all Mobil One product. I use Mobil one in all my cars.
customer_reviews.author: K. AGBOYIBOR

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. I thing it keeps the transmission safe ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. I thing it keeps the transmission safe for very long time. I am planning to flush with this fluid every 30K miles.
customer_reviews.author: nanchilraja

customer_reviews.title: Dextron 3, not 6
customer_reviews.text: Product description does not specify, but this is Dextron 3 and NOT Dextron 6. Didn't find this out until I received the product and looked at the back of the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: Not Applicable....
customer_reviews.text: Having used Mobil 1 synthetic oil in all my cars for 20+ years, I was eager to use this too. Unfortunately it turned out not to be something I could use in our Honda van. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Dad of All Trades
